block.p: In a blow to casino owners, the House failed to approve a bill to curb the exploding $1.2 billion industry of Internet gambling. Most lawmakers favored banning online casino-style games, sports wagers and lottery sales. But despite wide backing -- from Christian evangelists to liquor store owners -- they fell short of the votes needed to limit debate.
